events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle on the highway.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the description of the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to ensure proper handling of the auto accident claim.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the customer was informed about the next steps in the process.
We requested the customer to submit the police report and photos of the damaged vehicle for claim processing.
The customer provided all requested documents, including the police report and detailed images of the accident.
Investigation commenced to verify the details of the collision and assess the extent of damages to the vehicle.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and repair cost estimates accurately determined.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on repair costs and policy coverage limits.
Customer agreed with the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved and the settlement terms were finalized.
The insurance payment was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The claim case was formally closed following successful payment and customer confirmation of repair commencement.
All claim documents and records were archived in the system for future reference and audit purposes.
